bill.title: All-of-the-Above Federal Building Energy Conservation Act of 2018

item.latestTitle: All-of-the-Above Federal Building Energy Conservation Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 126 (Thursday, July 26, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CARTER of Georgia:H.R. 6584.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress Under Article I, Section 8 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H7726]

item.title: All-of-the-Above Federal Building Energy Conservation Act of 2018
To improve energy performance in Federal buildings, and for other purposes.
All-of-the-Above Federal Building Energy Conservation Act of 2018

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
